subject: Concussions
lead_paragraph: Nike is recalling about 235,000 helmet chin straps after the company received 18 reports of the chin straps breaking, including some that resulted in concussions and facial lacerations, a government safety group announced. Nike has received two reports of concussions, two reports of facial lacerations requiring stitches, and a report of a broken nose. The chin straps, made in China, were sold at sporting-goods stores nationwide and on Nike’s Web site from April 2006 through October 2007.
